---
title: Templates
description: "Production-ready starting points"
---

Templates are production-ready projects that deploy without configuration. Pick one based on what you're building.

## Available templates

<CardGroup cols={3}>
  <Card title="backend-service" icon="server" href="/templates/backend-service">
    Python FastAPI for APIs, webhooks, and agent backends.
  </Card>
  <Card title="static-site" icon="file-code" href="/templates/static-site">
    Next.js static export for landing pages and docs.
  </Card>
  <Card title="web-app" icon="browser" href="/templates/web-app">
    Fullstack app with Next.js frontend and FastAPI backend.
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

## Choosing a template

| Building | Use |
|----------|-----|
| REST API, webhook handler, agent backend | `backend-service` |
| Landing page, documentation, marketing site | `static-site` |
| Dashboard, SaaS app, admin panel | `web-app` |

## Getting started

```bash
runtm init backend-service
cd backend-service
runtm deploy
```

Every template deploys without edits. Add your code, then redeploy.

## What's included

```
my-project/
├── runtm.yaml              # Deployment manifest
├── runtm.discovery.yaml    # Search metadata
├── Dockerfile              # Build configuration
├── .runtmignore            # Artifact exclusions
├── README.md               # Documentation
├── AGENT.md                # AI assistant instructions
└── [application code]
```

## Optional features

Enable features in your `runtm.yaml`:

```yaml
features:
  database: true   # SQLite with persistent storage
  auth: true       # Better Auth (web-app only)
```

<Note>
Auth requires database to be enabled. Only available on `web-app` template.
</Note>

## Template requirements

| Template | Min tier | Port |
|----------|----------|------|
| `backend-service` | starter | 8080 |
| `static-site` | starter | 3000 |
| `web-app` | standard | 3000 |

The `web-app` template requires `standard` tier because it runs both Node.js and Python.
